revised_title: Sorption of Electrolytes by Cation-Exchange Resin Membranes: A Study of Activity Coefficients
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the sorption of various electrolytes by a cation-exchange resin membrane. They measured the activity coefficients of the electrolytes in the resin phase and examined their significance in terms of the Katchalsky & Lifson theory of polyelectrolyte solutions. This research provides a critical experimental test of the view that cation-exchange resins follow the laws of concentrated electrolyte solutions.
